qas.question: Who takes over as Speaker if the minority party gains control of the house?

answers.text: Minority Leader is usually the party's top choice for Speaker

qas.question: What meetings do Minority and Majority leaders usually meet to discuss?
Who is he current Minority leader?
If minority party takes control of congress, who is usually in link to become majority leader?
Who is the current Majority Leader?

plausible_answers.text: the Majority Leader and the Speaker

qas.question: Who does the Minority Whip usually meet with?
What does the Minority Whip meet with the Majority Leader and Speaker to discuss?

plausible_answers.text: during the convening of the Congress

qas.question: When is the Minority Whip on the ballot?

context: The current Minority Leader <a2_0><b4_0>Nancy Pelosi<b4_0/><a2_0/>, of the United States House of Representatives serves as floor <b5_0>leader of the opposition party<b5_0/>, and is the counterpart to the Majority Leader. Unlike the Majority Leader, the Minority Leader is on the ballot for Speaker of the House <b8_0>during the convening of the Congress<b8_0/>. If the Minority Leader's party takes control of the House, and the party officers are all re-elected to their seats, the <a0_0><a3_0>Minority Leader<a3_0/> is usually the party's top choice for Speaker<a0_0/> for the next Congress, while the Minority Whip is typically in line to become Majority Leader. The Minority Leader usually meets with <b6_0>the Majority Leader and the Speaker<b6_0/> to discuss <a1_0><b7_0>agreements on controversial issues<b7_0/><a1_0/>.
